stories.text:
I recently heard that some senior management at my company monitor employee "work habit" using Microsoft Office's Viva monitoring (across all their reports).

I do get "Viva digest" email, but it is grossly inaccurate for me. It says I have "80%" focus time when clearly I have been in meetings (sometimes unnecessary but beyond my control) and in-person collaboration all day for a week.

I can't think what could be wrong! Sometimes I don't get time to "accept" my meetings (mainly because I haven't figured out which one of my conflicts to pick) but I still attend the one I feel is appropriate.

Could Viva be using this to predict that I am not attending a meeting?

Where is the accountability on Microsoft for having designed unverifiable and un-auditable monitoring methods that clearly could affect people's career?

Do they assume I am "working" entirely inside office products?

I am fairly key employee that I am not particularly worried, and my immediate manager is a sane person. but I can't imagine what happens to some poor soul who needs to keep their job.

I guess I will stop my rant. Anyone with similar experience?
